actions-list.actionItem: The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for approximately 6:30 P.M. today.

actions-list.header: Board of Trustees for the John C. Stennis Center for Public Service Training and Development
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to Section 114(b) of the John C. Stennis Center for Public Service Training and Development Act (2 U.S.C. 1103), the Democratic Leader reappointed the following member of the House to the Board of Trustees for the John C. Stennis Center for Public Service Training and Development: Ms. Sewell (six year term).

actions-list.header: The Speaker laid before the House a message from the President transmitting a notification stating that the national emergency with respect to Belarus that was declared in Executive Order 13405 of June 16, 2006, is to continue in effect beyond June 16, 2023
actions-list.actionItem: referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs and ordered to be printed (H. Doc. 118-47).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 662.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Cammack moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 662 — "To amend the Disaster Relief Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2023 to improve disaster relief funding for agricultural producers, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. Bergman objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was considered as withdrawn.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 467.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Bergman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 467 — "To modify the age requirement for the Student Incentive Payment Program of the State maritime academies."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3099.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. McCaul moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3099 — "To establish in the Department of State the position of Special Envoy for the Abraham Accords, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. McCaul objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was considered as withdrawn.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 272.
Considered under suspension of the rules. H. Res. 272 — "Calling on the Government of the Russian Federation to immediately release United States citizen Paul Whelan."
Mr. McCaul moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution. H. Res. 272 — "Calling on the Government of the Russian Federation to immediately release United States citizen Paul Whelan."

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. McCaul objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was considered as withdrawn.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 377.

Considered under suspension of the rules. H. Res. 377 — "Calling for the immediate release of Evan Gershkovich, a United States citizen and journalist, who was wrongfully detained by the Government of the Russian Federation in March 2023."

Mr. McCaul moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended. H. Res. 377 — "Calling for the immediate release of Evan Gershkovich, a United States citizen and journalist, who was wrongfully detained by the Government of the Russian Federation in March 2023."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of June 12.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Joyce of PA to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of June 12.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
